item.title: Reform U.K. is Said to Land Over $1 Million in Populist Show of Force
item.description: Nigel Farage’s party is reshaping British conservatism and showing that it can raise money to do so.

item.title: Mauricio Funes, Salvadoran President Who Fled to Nicaragua, Dies at 65

item.title: Trudeau Government Left Canada Vulnerable to Foreign Interference

item.title: How Elon Musk is Using Start-Up Tactics to Disrupt European Politics
item.description: The richest man in the world is backing far-right parties against a political establishment that has failed to deliver.

item.title: Protesters Attack Embassies in Congo Amid Fury Over Rebel Violence
item.description: Many blame the United States, France and other allies for allowing neighboring Rwanda to fuel a conflict in the country’s east.
